intro: Brunia levisanus, commonly known as the soft-stemmed brunia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces clusters of violet to purple flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, velvety texture. Brunia levisanus is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and as a ground cover due to its ornamental value and adaptability.
